revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = George Logothetis | image = <!-- just the filename, without the File: or Image: prefix or enclosing [[brackets]] --> | alt = | caption = | birth_date = {{Birth-date and age|January 18, 1975}} | birth_place = [[London]] | death_date = <!-- {{Death date and age|YYYY|MM|DD|YYYY|MM|DD}} or {{Death-date and age|death date†|birth date†}} --> | death_place = | residence = [[New York City]] | nationality = | other_names = | occupation = Founder, Chairman, and CEO of the [[Libra Group]] | net_worth = }} '''George Michael Logothetis''' (born January 18, 1975) is an international businessman. He is from a [[Greece|Greek]] shipping family, grew up in [[London]] and has British citizenship,<ref name=bbc>Musafer, Shanaz. [https://www.bbc.com/news/business-23041304 "Family values help Greek shipping business go global"]. ''[[BBC News]]''. July 7, 2013.</ref><ref name=fox>[http://video.foxbusiness.com/v/3092316234001/2014-the-year-of-greek-growth/#sp=show-clips "2014 the year of Greek growth?"]. [[Fox Business Network|Fox Business]]. January 22, 2014.</ref> and has lived in [[New York City]] since 2004.<ref name=bbc /><ref name=ft>Wright, Robert. [http://www.ft.com/intl/cms/s/0/e04cb0aa-ea5d-11e2-913c-00144feabdc0.html#axzz2zh43BJRz "Families will keep shipping buoyant, says Greek tycoon"]. ''[[Financial Times]]''. July 14, 2013.</ref> In 2014 ''[[Fortune (magazine)|Fortune]]'' named him one of its "[[40 under 40 (Fortune magazine)|40 under 40]]".<ref name=fortune31 /><ref name=portfolio />
Logothetis is the chairman and CEO of the [[Libra Group]], a diversified international privately owned conglomerate company which he founded in 2003. As of 2017, the Libra Group owns and operates 30 subsidiary companies around the world, mainly in six separate industries: [[Aircraft lease|aviation leasing]], [[renewable energy]], [[hotel|hotels and hospitality services]], [[real estate]], [[financial services]] and [[holding company|diversified investments]], and [[shipping]].<ref name=official>[http://www.libra.com/en/ Libra Group – Official website]. Retrieved January 11, 2017.</ref><ref name=holdings>[https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/private/snapshot.asp?privcapId=84145892 "Company Overview of Libra Holdings Ltd."] ''[[Bloomberg Businessweek]]''. Retrieved March 16, 2017.</ref><ref name=returning />
==Early life and education== George Logothetis was born in 1975 in [[London]] to Greek-born parents, and he grew up there.<ref name=kathimerini/><ref name=bbc /><ref name=fox /><ref>[http://www.companiesintheuk.co.uk/director/5249995/george-logothetis George Michael Logothetis]. ''CompaniesintheUK.co.uk''. Retrieved June 2, 2014.</ref> He was educated at [[Highgate School]] from 1987 to 1993.<ref>Hughes, Patrick; Davies, Ian F. (eds). ''Highgate School Register 1833–1988''. (7th edition) p. 433.</ref>
As a very young child he contracted [[meningitis]], a disease which threatened his life and thereafter created debilitating health problems which left him bed-ridden for many days at a time, several times a year, until he had an operation at the age of 36 which cured the condition.<ref name=beyond/><ref name=kathimerini>Varvitsiotis, Eleni [http://www.kathimerini.gr/849472/article/proswpa/geyma-me-thn-k/giwrgos-logo8eths-panw-ap-ola-h-ellada-einai-ta-synora-ths-dyshs "George Logothetis: Above all, Greece is the border of the West"] (Greek). ''[[Kathimerini]]'' 14 February 2016.</ref><ref name=oxi>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kva3bb8LGb0&t=3m10s 2015 Oxi Day Foundation Gala Keynote Speech - George Logothetis] (3:10–6:30). [[Oxi Day]] Foundation. November 5, 2015.</ref> He has stated that living with a compromised immune system for so long gave him an enormous appreciation of life and an ability to find inspiration in the face of difficulties.<ref name=beyond>Logothetis, George. [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vVW4bkGZqN8&t=7m45s "The Opportunity in Adversity"] (7:45–12:00). ''Beyond Conference''. 2016.</ref><ref name=kathimerini/><ref name=oxi/>
He is the eldest of four sons of [[Greek shipping]] businessman Michael G. Logothetis,<ref name=bbc /> and his brothers are Constantine, Nicholas, and Leon.<ref name=rothman>Rothman, Andrea. [https://web.archive.org/web/20120219030218/https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2012-02-12/libra-buys-agustawestland-helicopters-to-start-leasing-business.html "Libra Buys AgustaWestland Helicopters to Start Leasing Business"]. ''[[Bloomberg News]]''. February 12, 2012.</ref> His father started a small shipping business, Lomar Shipping, in 1976.<ref name=bbc /><ref>[https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/private/snapshot.asp?privcapId=106300281 Lomar Shipping Limited] – Profile at ''[[Bloomberg Businessweek]]''. Retrieved March 16, 2017.</ref> George was exposed to the business from a very early age, and as a teenager he also spent summers abroad learning the details of the trade.<ref name=bbc />
Logothetis began his business career immediately after high school and did not complete a university degree. In 2013, on the merits of his numerous accomplishments and philanthropies, he received an [[honorary doctorate]] from the [[American College of Greece]].<ref name=deree>Papapostolou, Anastasios. [http://greece.greekreporter.com/2013/07/05/deree-commencement-500-graduates-and-a-moving-speech-by-libra-ceo/ "Deree Commencement: 500 Graduates and a Moving Speech by Libra CEO"]. ''[[Greek Reporter]]''. July 5, 2013.</ref><ref name=pappas>Pappas, Gregory C. [http://www.huffingtonpost.com/gregory-c-pappas/george-logothetis_b_3589190.html "Vision Without Implementation Is Just a Hallucination: The Amazing Case of George Logothetis"]. ''[[Huffington Post]]''. July 12, 2013.</ref>
==Career== Logothetis started working at his father's shipping company, Lomar Shipping, in 1993 at the age of 18.<ref name=bloomberg>[https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/private/person.asp?personId=84145977&privcapId=84145892 George M. Logothetis] – Profile at ''[[Bloomberg Businessweek]]''. Retrieved March 16, 2017.</ref> By 1995 he was CEO of the company.<ref name=wealthiest /> Over the next ten years, he enlarged the fleet from less than five to more than 70 ships.<ref name=bbc />
Logothetis's philosophy from the start was to work hard, and then take three to five months off every five years to reflect about the next five years.<ref>[http://fortune.com/video/2015/04/17/why-this-ceo-takes-5-months-off/ "Why this CEO takes 5 months off"] (video). ''[[Fortune (magazine)|Fortune]]''. April 17, 2015.</ref> During these hiatuses, he avoids work emails and phone calls, believing that "ideas need space to be born".<ref name=bbc /><ref name=kostis>Christodoulou, Kostis. [http://news247.gr/eidiseis/weekend-edition/giwrgos_logotheths_o_39xronos_omogenhs_epixeirhmatias_poy_tha_zhleye_akomh_kai_o_wnashs.2691588.html "George Logothetis: the 39-year-old expat businessman that even Onassis would envy"] (Greek). ''News 247''. March 16, 2014.</ref> On his first sabbatical, he traveled around Asia, and on his second, he did some university studies in New York City.<ref name=bbc />
During his three-month sabbatical in New York, the idea of diversification came to him.<ref name=bbc /> In 2003 Logothetis, with his brother Constantine, created and founded the [[Libra Group]], based in New York and London, in order to diversify and expand his company.<ref name=bbc /><ref name=wealthiest />
Between 2004 and 2007, during a boom in the shipping business, the Libra Group sold off most of Lomar's ships.<ref name=returning>Saul, Jonathan. [https://www.reuters.com/article/2013/03/07/greece-libra-investment-idUSL6N0BY6S020130307 "Interview - Conglomerate Libra sees investors returning to Greece"]. ''[[Reuters]]''. March 7, 2013.</ref> With the profit from the ship sales, the new company purchased a fleet of airplanes, which were at a cyclical low, and set up an aircraft leasing division, [[Lease Corporation International]].<ref name=bbc /> Logothetis repeated this successful "buy-low, sell-high" formula of going counter to prevailing market trends several times in the ensuing decade, building a large diversified multinational conglomerate out of what was once a small shipping company.<ref name=ft /><ref name=returning /><ref name=wealthiest /><ref name=kostis />
"The idea behind Libra was to diversify away from shipping to create a global group, using the top lieutenants we had worked with in the preceding years", Logothetis told ''[[Reuters]]'' in 2013.<ref name=returning /> He told ''[[Fortune (magazine)|Fortune]]'' he "took all the great people from our shipping business, and sent them around the world to start companies. We ended up with a ship's captain running a $200 million real estate company and a Russian fruit seller who runs six [[biogas]] plants in Latvia."<ref>[http://money.cnn.com/gallery/news/companies/2012/10/25/best-advice.fortune/19.html "George Logothetis: The best advice I ever got"]. ''[[Fortune (magazine)|Fortune]]''. October 25, 2012.</ref> He later reiterated to [[BBC News]] how he expanded and diversified the company: "'We designed a framework of all the places in the world that we wanted to have an office and representation in. Next to each place we put the name of a person that we knew – a family member, a friend or an employee.' These people were sent out to different locations and given the chance to learn new businesses."<ref name=bbc />
In 2006, the Libra Group started expanding beyond aviation. Its new major ventures included real estate, hotels and hospitality, and renewable energy.<ref name=bbc /><ref>Brady, Diane. [http://www.businessweek.com/articles/2012-06-19/greek-american-exec-what-everyone-needs-now-is-certainty "Executive on Greece: 'What Everyone Needs Now Is Certainty'"]. ''[[Businessweek]]''. June 19, 2012.</ref>
In December 2009, after ship values slumped in the wake of the financial crisis, Logothetis again entered the shipping business and purchased Allocean and its fleet of 26 ships.<ref name=ft /><ref>[http://english.capital.gr/News.asp?id=868174 "Lomar Shipping Makes Super Deal"]. ''Capital.gr''. December 8, 2009.</ref><ref>[http://www.tradewindsnews.com/weekly/226100/logothetis-family-marks-return-to-shipping-with-325m-buy "Logothetis family marks return to shipping with $325m buy"]. ''[[TradeWinds (newspaper)|TradeWinds]]''. June 3, 2010.</ref> From December 2009 through December 2014, the company purchased a total of 91 vessels.<ref>Saul, Jonathan. [https://www.reuters.com/article/2014/12/11/shipping-libra-idUSL6N0TU4B120141211 "Conglomerate Libra ramps up container ship buying, bets on upturn"]. ''[[Reuters]]''. December 11, 2014.</ref>
The Libra Group has also expanded beyond its core businesses of [[shipping]], [[Aircraft lease|aviation]], [[real estate]], [[hotel|hotels and hospitality]], and [[renewable energy]], to include a variety of interests including helicopter leasing, [[financial services]] and [[holding company|diversified investments]], media, and construction.<ref name=official/><ref name=rothman /><ref name=wealthiest /><ref name=holdings/><ref name=turns>Saul, Jonathan. [http://uk.reuters.com/article/2014/03/19/greece-investment-libra-idUKL6N0ME45Y20140319 "Interview - Libra Group invests in Greece as economy turns up".] ''[[Reuters]]''. March 19, 2014.</ref> Between 2008 and 2014, the company purchased $7 billion to $7.5 billion of assets globally.<ref name=turns /> As of 2017, the Libra Group owns and operates 30 subsidiary companies around the world.<ref name=returning /><ref name=official/>
Logothetis has been an advocate for and an investor in Greece during the [[Greek financial crisis]].<ref name=bbc /><ref name=dabilis /> And as a result of the crisis, he has become a sought-after business leader for his opinions on investing in Greece and in Greek assets, products, and industries. In June 2012, following prime minister [[Antonis Samaras]]'s election and instatement, he emphasized that the promise of governmental stability was bringing back business confidence and individual confidence in Greece, and noted Libra Group's numerous recent and projected Greek investments and businesses.<ref name=returning /><ref name=dabilis /> In March 2013, he cited Samaras's coalition government's relieving the Greek [[eurozone]] crisis as a reason investors were returning to, and should continue to return to, Greece.<ref name=returning /> In late 2013, he sounded a cautionary note concerning the "buying frenzy" occurring in the slump-ridden shipping sector.<ref name=banks>Saul, Jonathan. [http://uk.reuters.com/article/2013/12/18/shipping-banks-idUKL6N0JV2JF20131218 "Funds buy shipping loans from capital-conscious banks"]. ''[[Reuters]]''. December 18, 2013.</ref> Speaking to a reporter in January 2014 at [[Davos]], he encouraged businesspersons to see the opportunity available in Greece, and stated that he felt that 2014 would be "the year of Greek growth".<ref name=fox /><ref>Papapostolou, Anastasios. [http://eu.greekreporter.com/2014/01/26/george-logothetis-from-davos-2014-is-the-year-of-greek-growth/ "George Logothetis from Davos: '2014 is the Year of Greek Growth'"]. ''[[Greek Reporter]]''. January 26, 2014.</ref> He reiterated his optimism in March 2014, noting that the Libra Group had invested $500 million in Greece since 2012.<ref name=turns />
==Outreach and philanthropies== Logothetis has been publicly active in outreach and philanthropy, particularly in the wake of the Greek financial crisis.<ref>Lussier, Robert N.; Corman, Joel M.; Kimball, David. [https://books.google.com/books?id=q2QKBAAAQBAJ&pg=PA64 ''Entrepreneurial New Venture Skills'']. [[Routledge]], 2014. p. 64.</ref> At a dinner meeting of 14 Greek Americans seeking to improve the lives of their countrymen, he conceived a plan for an internship program under the auspices of the Libra Group, in conjunction with the Greek America Foundation and the [[American College of Greece]], placing young Greeks and Greek Americans in Libra Group's 25 locations across the world, giving them hope and opportunity.<ref name=pappas /> This project became the Libra Internship Program, which launched in 2011.<ref>Papapostolou, Anastasios.[http://usa.greekreporter.com/2011/07/03/libra-group-announces-internship-program-with-greek-america-foundation/ "Libra Group Announces Internship Program with Greek America Foundation"]. ''[[Greek Reporter]]''. July 3, 2011.</ref><ref>Seiradaki, Emmanouela. [http://greece.greekreporter.com/2011/09/29/libra-group-the-american-college-of-greece-launch-unique-international-internship-program/ "Libra Group & The American College of Greece Launch Unique International Internship Program"]. ''[[Greek Reporter]]''. September 29, 2011.</ref><ref name=mark>Papapostolou, Anastasios. [http://usa.greekreporter.com/2011/12/31/10-greeks-of-diaspora-that-left-their-mark-in-2011/ "10 Greeks of Diaspora that Left Their Mark in 2011"]. ''[[Greek Reporter]]''. December 31, 2011.</ref> Initially focused solely on Greek and [[Greek diaspora]] students,<ref>Papapostolou, Anastasios. [http://usa.greekreporter.com/2014/01/17/2014-libra-program-get-your-dream-internship/ "2014 Libra Program: Get Your Dream Internship!"]. ''[[Greek Reporter]]''. January 17, 2014.</ref><ref name=csr>[http://csringreece.gr/forum/2013/cv/logothetis.pdf George Logothetis – Chairman and CEO, The Libra Group]. [[Corporate social responsibility|CSR]] in Greece. ''CSRinGreece.gr''. 2013.</ref> as of 2015 the program provides internships for up to 100 students per year at Libra Group and its subsidiaries, and includes placements for students from socio-economically disadvantaged backgrounds and Haitian students.<ref>[http://www.librainternship.com/ Libra Group Internships]. ''LibraInternship.com''. Retrieved March 16, 2017.</ref><ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20150107064337/http://www.mdc.edu/main/news/articles/2014/11/mdcjoins_forces_with_the_libra_group_to_.aspx "Miami Dade College Joins Forces with the Libra Group to Offer Unique International Internship Opportunities"]. [[Miami Dade College]]. November 3, 2014.</ref><ref name=mbkprn /><ref name=underdog />
Via the Libra Group, Logothetis also supports MBA students at [[Athens University of Economics and Business]],<ref name=csr /><ref>[http://aueb2.dmst.aueb.gr/pages_en/news/popup_en_t.php?catid=17&index=44 "AUEB's MBA Programme of the Departments of Business Administration and Marketing & Communication is pleased to announce the Libra Group Fellowship Programme"]. [[Athens University of Economics and Business]]. June 6, 2013.</ref> and engages in a variety of other nonprofit philanthropic and educational programs.<ref>[http://www.libra.com/en/social-responsibility/ "Social Responsibility"]. ''Libra.com''. Retrieved January 17, 2017.</ref><ref name=mbkgr /> In 2012, along with three fellow diaspora Greeks, he founded The Hellenic Initiative, a global nonprofit focused on mobilizing the Greek diaspora and pro-Greek community to invest in Greece through programs of crisis relief, entrepreneurship, and economic development.<ref name=raises>Papapostolou, Anastasios. [http://usa.greekreporter.com/2013/10/05/the-hellenic-initiative-raises-1-9-million-one-greece/ "The Hellenic Initiative Raises $1.9 Million for #OneGreece"]. ''[[Greek Reporter]]''. October 5, 2013.</ref><ref>[https://www.thehellenicinitiative.org/who-we-are/ "Who We Are"]. ''HellenicInitiative.com''. Retrieved March 16, 2017.</ref><ref>[http://hellenicinitiative.com/web/who-we-are/leadership/ The Hellenic Initiative Board of Directors: Executive Committee]. ''HellenicInitiative.com''. Retrieved March 16, 2017.</ref> Also in 2012, the Libra Group pledged [[€]]5{{nbsp}}million to create the initiative's Hellenic Entrepreneurship Award, which provides mentorship and funding to Greek entrepreneurs;<ref name=dabilis>Dabilis, Andy. [http://greece.greekreporter.com/2013/03/10/libra-group-stepping-up-investments-in-greece/ "Libra Group Stepping Up Investments in Greece"]. ''[[Greek Reporter]]''. March 10, 2013.</ref><ref name=raises /><ref>Papapostolou, Anastasios. [http://greece.greekreporter.com/2012/11/28/hellenic-initiative-launches-entrepreneurship-award-with-e5m-commitment/ "Hellenic Initiative Launches Entrepreneurship Award with €5M Commitment"]. ''[[Greek Reporter]]''. November 28, 2012.</ref><ref>[http://www.hellenicaward.com/en/ Hellenic Entrepreneurship Award]. ''HellenicAward.com''. Retrieved March 16, 2017.</ref> as of 2017, the Libra Group has committed €10{{nbsp}}million to supporting entrepreneurship in Greece through the award.<ref>[https://www.thenationalherald.com/142715/hellenic-entrepreneurship-award-2017-seeking-submissions/ "Hellenic Entrepreneurship Award 2017 Seeking Submissions"]. ''[[The National Herald]]''. November 26, 2016.</ref>
At the Greek America Foundation’s 2012 National Innovation Conference, he encouraged fellow Greeks to revitalize Greece by rediscovering and implementing ''[[philotimo]]'', a complex and comprehensive core Greek value roughly translating as honor and altruism.<ref>Papapostolou, Anastasios. [http://usa.greekreporter.com/2012/05/28/george-logothetis-what-we-have-built-has-been-underwritten-by-philotimo/ "George Logothetis: 'What We Have Built Has Been Underwritten by Philotimo'"]. ''[[Greek Reporter]]''. May 28, 2012.</ref><ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20140606215509/http://www.thesocializers.com/blog/tag/george-logothetis/ "Inspired by Greece"]. ''TheSocializers.com''. 2012.</ref> He also gave detailed inspirational speeches at the 2011 and 2013 Gabby Awards presented by the Greek America Foundation.<ref>[http://www.gabbyawards.com/about-us/past-gabby-awards/event-highlights/ "The 2011 Gabby Awards Weekend Wrap-Up"]. ''GabbyAwards.com''.</ref><ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HwV6r7NzXLI 2013 Gabby Awards – George Logothetis]. Greek America Foundation.</ref> He has written several articles for the ''[[Huffington Post]]'', beginning in 2012.<ref>[http://www.huffingtonpost.com/george-logothetis/ George Logothetis] – Profile at ''[[Huffington Post]]''. Retrieved March 16, 2017.</ref><ref>Logothetis, George. [http://www.huffingtonpost.com/george-logothetis/greece-is-also-having-a-s_b_1542891.html "Greece Is Also Having a Social Crisis"]. ''[[Huffington Post]]''. May 24, 2012.</ref><ref>Logothetis, George. [http://www.huffingtonpost.com/george-logothetis/memories-of-yesterday-or-_b_4063527.html "Memories of Yesterday, or Hopes for Tomorrow?"]. ''[[Huffington Post]]''. October 9, 2013.</ref><ref>Logothetis, George. [http://www.huffingtonpost.com/george-logothetis/a-defining-moment-immigra_b_4731576.html "A Defining Moment: Immigration Reform in 2014"]. ''[[Huffington Post]]''. February 5, 2014.</ref>
Logothetis co-founded the nonprofit [[Seleni Institute]], which supports the mental and emotional well-being of women, with his wife Nitzia, who is a psychotherapist. The institute, which was founded in 2011 and launched in 2013 in New York City, promotes the mental health of mothers and their families through funding research, raising and providing awareness, and providing clinical care.<ref name=doors>Papapostolou, Anastasios. [http://usa.greekreporter.com/2013/05/06/seleni-institute-opens-its-doors-to-help-women/ "Seleni Institute Opens Its Doors to Help Women"]. ''[[Greek Reporter]]''. May 6, 2013.</ref><ref>[http://seleni.org/about "About Us"]. [[Seleni Institute]]. ''Seleni.org''. Retrieved March 16, 2017.</ref><ref name=owl>[http://seleni.org/uploads/The_Owl_Fall_2013_(dragged).pdf "Alumni Profile: Nitzia Embiricos Logothetis – Alumna Founds Maternal Health Institute in NYC"]. ''The Owl'' (newsletter), College Year in Athens. Fall 2013.</ref> George is the treasurer of the organization.<ref name=seleniboard>[http://seleni.org/about/leadership/board-of-directors Seleni Institute: Board of Directors]. ''Seleni.org''. Retrieved November 20, 2016.</ref><ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20131001034205/http://greekamericangirl.com/2013/09/18/seleni-institute-a-place-to-make-whole/ "Seleni Institute: A Place to Make Whole"]. ''Greek American Girl''. September 18, 2013.</ref> In 2014 the Seleni Institute was honored with the [[Archbishop Iakovos of America|Archbishop Iakovos]] Leadership 100 Award for Excellence.<ref name=archbishop>Papapostolou, Anastasios. [http://usa.greekreporter.com/2014/02/20/leadership-100-celebrates-30-years-honors-seleni-snf-furris/ "Leadership 100 Celebrates 30 Years; Honors Seleni, SNF, Furris"]. ''[[Greek Reporter]]''. February 20, 2014.</ref>
At the 2012 [[Concordia Summit]], Logothetis introduced [[Bill Clinton]], noting his salient traits of wisdom and empathy.<ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FLz1bOQg4Pk Q&A with President Bill Clinton – Introductory remarks by George Logothetis]. 2012 [[Concordia Summit]].</ref><ref>Papapostolou, Anastasios. [http://usa.greekreporter.com/2012/09/28/bill-clinton-there-is-nothing-wrong-with-greece-issue-bonds/ "Bill Clinton: 'There is Nothing Wrong with Greece – Issue Bonds'"]. ''[[Greek Reporter]]''. September 28, 2012.</ref><ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20140606223044/http://theconcordiasummit.org/annual-summits/2012-summit/agenda.html 2012 Agenda, The 2nd Annual Concordia Summit, September 27, 2012]. [[Concordia Summit]].</ref> At the 2013 Concordia Summit, he opened the summit with a well-received speech exhorting worldwide business leaders and government officials to empower young people with opportunity and hope, in order to reverse the tide of cynicism and hopelessness and to create a better tomorrow.<ref>Diamataris, Antonis H. [http://www.thenationalherald.com/28596/ "Concordia's 2013 Summit of Hope"]. ''[[The National Herald]]''. October 3, 2013.</ref><ref>[https://www.facebook.com/TheConcordiaSummit/posts/548927051829104 "George Logothetis delivers opening remarks at The Concordia Summit 2013"]. [[The Concordia Summit]] on [[Facebook]].</ref><ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20131113033220/http://theconcordiasummit.org/news/2013/10/17/the-2013-concordia-summit-highlights/ "The 2013 Concordia Summit Highlights"]. ''TheConcordiaSummit.org''.</ref><ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20140606235726/http://www.greekamerica.org/news/news-single/newsarticle/board-member-george-logothetis-on-empowering-young-people/ "Board Member George Logothetis on Empowering Young People"]. Greek America Foundation. 2013.</ref> In 2015 he was appointed Chairman of Concordia's Leadership Council,<ref>[http://www.concordia.net/press/concordia-appoints-george-logothetis-as-leadership-council-chairman/ "Concordia Appoints George Logothetis as Leadership Council Chairman"]. [[Concordia Summit]]. October 26, 2015.</ref> and he has spoken about leadership,<ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M8T0USTA-Eo "George M. Logothetis Speaks About Leadership"] (video). [[Concordia Summit]]. September 2014.</ref> overcoming adversity,<ref>[http://www.darden.virginia.edu/news/2016/libra-group-darden/ "Libra Group CEO Rides Underdog Mentality to Global Success"]. [[University of Virginia Darden School of Business]]. March 2, 2016.</ref> and empowering the underdog<ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0c9SXPBY2OI "George Logothetis talks about the responsibility we all have to contribute at Concordia 2016"] (video). [[Concordia Summit]]. September 2016.</ref> at Concordia and elsewhere, including a 2016 [[TEDx]] talk.<ref>Logothetis, George. [http://www.tedxacademy.com/talks/2016-george-logothetis "Empowering the Underdog"] (video). TEDxAcademy. 2016.</ref>
Logothetis is on the Board of Directors of the My Brother's Keeper (MBK) Alliance, launched in May 2015 by [[President Obama]].<ref name=mbkprn /><ref name=underdog>Papapostolou, Anastasios. [http://usa.greekreporter.com/2014/09/10/the-underdog-who-surprised-the-system/ "The Underdog Who Surprised the System"]. ''[[Greek Reporter]]''. September 10, 2014.</ref><ref>[http://www.mbkalliance.org/about-us/ About Us]. My Brother's Keeper Alliance. Retrieved March 16, 2017.</ref> The Libra Group is a founding sponsor of the program.<ref name=mbkgr>Papapostolou, Anastasios. [http://usa.greekreporter.com/2015/05/05/libra-group-announces-partnership-with-president-obamas-my-brothers-keeper-alliance/ "Libra Group Announces Partnership with President Obama’s My Brother’s Keeper Alliance"]. ''[[Greek Reporter]]''. May 5, 2015.</ref><ref name=mbk>[http://bronxmama.com/2015/05/05/president-obama-visits-the-bronx-to-launch-my-brothers-keeper-alliance/ "President Obama Visits the Bronx to Launch My Brother’s Keeper Alliance"]. ''BronxMama.com''. May 5, 2015.</ref> The MBK Alliance helps young men of color throughout the U.S. reach their full potential, by ensuring and improving educational and workplace opportunities.<ref name=mbk /><ref name=acg>[http://www.acg.edu/web/touchbase-issue22/?p=26 "Deree's Libra Interns Meet President Barack Obama"]. ''Touch Base''. [[American College of Greece]]. Issue 22, January 2015.</ref> As part of its involvement with the original [[My Brother's Keeper Initiative]] launched by Obama in February 2014, the Libra Group has partnered with Leadership Enterprise for a Diverse America (LEDA) by providing internship placements for young men of color at Libra and its global subsidiaries.<ref name=mbkprn>[http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/libra-group-announces-partnership-with-president-obamas-my-brothers-keeper-alliance-300076941.html "Libra Group Announces Partnership with President Obama's My Brother's Keeper Alliance"]. ''[[PR Newswire]]''. May 4, 2015.</ref><ref name=underdog /><ref name=acg /><ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20151222085951/http://www.ledascholars.org/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/2014-Fall-Newsletter.pdf ''LEDA News'']. Leadership Enterprise for a Diverse America. Fall 2014. p. 6.</ref> In 2016 the Libra Group also joined two other Obama administration initiatives, the [[Partnership for Refugees]]<ref>[[The White House]]. [https://www.whitehouse.gov/the-press-office/2016/09/20/private-sector-participants-call-action "Private Sector Participants to the Call to Action"]. ''WhiteHouse.gov''. September 20, 2016.</ref> and the Equal Pay Pledge.<ref> Knoepp, Lilly. [https://www.forbes.com/sites/lillyknoepp/2016/08/26/these-55-companies-are-committed-to-equal-pay "These 57 Companies Are Committed To Equal Pay"]. ''[[Forbes]]''. August 26, 2016.</ref><ref>[[The White House]]. [https://www.whitehouse.gov/the-press-office/2016/08/26/fact-sheet-white-house-announces-new-commitments-equal-pay-pledge "Fact Sheet: White House Announces New Commitments to the Equal Pay Pledge"]. ''WhiteHouse.gov''. August 26, 2016.</ref>
==Awards and honors== *In 2013 Logothetis received an [[Honorary Doctorate]] from the [[American College of Greece]].<ref name=deree /> *In 2014 he and his wife Nitzia received the [[Archbishop Iakovos of America|Archbishop Iakovos]] Leadership 100 Award for Excellence for their charity the [[Seleni Institute]].<ref name=archbishop /> *In 2014 ''[[Fortune (magazine)|Fortune]]'' named him one of its "[[40 under 40 (Fortune magazine)|40 under 40]]".<ref name=fortune31>[https://web.archive.org/web/20141101142134/http://fortune.com/40-under-40/george-logothetis-31 "George Logothetis"]. [[40 under 40 (Fortune magazine)|"40 under 40" 2014]]. ''[[Fortune (magazine)|Fortune]]''. 2014.</ref><ref name=portfolio>[http://fortune.com/2014/10/09/40-under-40-portfolio/ "40 Under 40: Portfolio"]. ''[[Fortune (magazine)|Fortune]]''. October 9, 2014.</ref> *In 2014 he received the Capital Link Leadership Award, for his contribution to numerous educational and philanthropic initiatives globally and in Greece.<ref>[http://forums.capitallink.com/greece/2014/journal.pdf#page=7 16th Annual Capital Link Invest in Greece Forum]. Capital Link. ''CapitalLink.com''. December 1, 2014. p. 5.</ref> *In 2015 he received the [[Seatrade]] Young Person in Shipping award.<ref>[http://www.seatrade-awards.com/index.php/winners/winners-2015 Seatrade Awards – 2015 Winners]. [[Seatrade]]. May 6, 2015.</ref> *In 2015 he received the [[Lloyd's List]] Greek Shipping Personality of the Year award.<ref>{{cite web|title=Lloyd’s List Greek Shipping Awards|url=http://greekshippingawards.com/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151214232212/http://greekshippingawards.com/|dead-url=yes|archive-date=December 14, 2015|accessdate=December 14, 2015}}</ref> *In 2017 he received the Corporate Bridge Builder Award from the [[Tanenbaum Center for Interreligious Understanding]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://usa.greekreporter.com/2017/05/24/libra-group-honored-at-2017-tanenbaum-gala/|title=Libra Group Honored at 2017 Tanenbaum Gala {{!}} USA.GreekReporter.com|date=2017-05-24|work=USA.GreekReporter.com|access-date=2017-11-03|language=en-US}}</ref>
==Personal life== Logothetis and his wife Nitzia (née Embiricos) are based in [[Manhattan]], and have two sons and a daughter.<ref name=wealthiest>[https://s3.amazonaws.com/2013backup/tnhcontent/pdf/inserts/2013/Insert_3_2013_7432.pdf#page=12 "50 Wealthiest Greek Americans"]. ''[[The National Herald]]''. March 2, 2013. p. 12.</ref><ref name=seleniboard /><ref name=nic2012>[https://web.archive.org/web/20120428165753/http://www.greekamerica.org/nic/nic-presenters/2012-presenters/presenter-bios/showpersenter/logothetis George M. Logothetis]. National Innovation Conference, 2012 Presenters. ''GreekAmerica.org''.</ref> Nitzia, a psychotherapist, is a descendant of a Greek shipping family and grew up in England.<ref name=owl /><ref name=espresso>[http://www.espressonews.gr/%CF%80%CE%B5%CF%81%CE%B9%CE%B5%CF%87%CF%8C%CE%BC%CE%B5%CE%BD%CE%BF/%CE%AC%CF%81%CE%B8%CF%81%CE%BF/%CF%81%CE%B5%CF%80%CE%BF%CF%81%CF%84%CE%B1%CE%B6/127808/%CE%BF-%CE%B5%CE%BB%CE%BB%CE%B7%CE%BD%CE%B1%CF%82-%CE%BA%CF%81%CE%BF%CE%AF%CF%83%CE%BF%CF%82-%CF%80%CE%BF%CF%85-%CE%B1%CE%B3%CE%BF%CF%81%CE%AC%CE%B6%CE%B5%CE%B9-%CF%8C%CF%84%CE%B9-%CE%BA%CE%B9%CE%BD%CE%B5%CE%AF%CF%84%CE%B1%CE%B9 "The Greek tycoon who buys everything that moves!"] (Greek). ''Espresso''. March 30, 2014.</ref> She has a psychology degree from [[Brown University]], an [[MSc]] in child development from the [[University of London]], and an [[Master of Arts|MA]] in counseling for mental health and wellness from [[New York University]]'s [[Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development]].<ref name=doors /><ref name=seleniboard /> She heads the Seleni Institute, a nonprofit devoted to maternal psychological and physical care.<ref name=doors /><ref name=seleniboard />
==References== {{reflist|2}}
==External links== *[http://www.libra.com/en/people/executive-team/george-m-logothetis George M. Logothetis] – Official profile at the [[Libra Group]] *[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IdXXyRzuy0E Opening remarks] at the 2013 [[Concordia Summit]]

revision.text:
'''GlassPoint Solar''' is a private company founded in 2009 that designs and manufactures [[solar steam]] generators that use [[Solar thermal energy|solar thermal technology]] to generate steam for [[Enhanced oil recovery|enhanced oil recovery (EOR)]]. {{Infobox company | name = GlassPoint Solar | logo = GlassPoint Solar Logo Small.tiff | type = Private | industry = [[Solar thermal energy]] | num_employees = 300-500 | homepage = {{URL|glasspoint.com}} }}
==Overview==
[[File:GlassPoint Amal EOR Project.jpg|thumb|right|7MW Solar EOR project in Amal, Oman]] [[File:GlassPoint Amal EOR Steam.jpg|thumb|right|Generating steam for EOR using concentrated solar power]]
GlassPoint’s [[Solar Enhanced Oil Recovery#enclosed trough|enclosed trough technology]] encloses lightweight mirrors in a standard agricultural greenhouse, concentrating the sun’s energy to heat water and create steam. The steam is then injected in an oil reservoir to aid the extraction of heavy crude.<ref>{{cite news|title=Solar heat for Oil Wells|url=http://www.economist.com/node/21525837|publisher=[[The Economist]]|accessdate=15 August 2013|date=13 August 2011}}</ref> The company’s solar thermal technology uses trough-shaped mirrors, standard piping and a greenhouse structure.<ref>{{cite news|last=Helman|first=Christopher|title=Oil from the Sun|url=https://www.forbes.com/forbes/2011/0425/features-glasspoint-greenhouses-green-energy-oil-from-sun.html|publisher=[[Forbes]]|accessdate=15 August 2013}}</ref> By using the enclosed trough architecture, GlassPoint claims it can produce emission-free steam for two to three times less than competing [[Concentrating solar power|concentrated solar power]] technologies, such as the [[Solar thermal energy#Power tower designs|power tower]] and [[Solar thermal energy#linlear Fresnel Reflector technologies|linear fresnel]].<ref>{{cite news|last=Goossens|first=Ehren|title=Chevron Uses Solar-Thermal Steam to Extract OIl in California|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2011-10-03/chevron-using-solar-thermal-steam-at-enhanced-oil-recovery-plant.html|accessdate=15 August 2013|work=Bloomberg|date=3 October 2011}}</ref> The company is based in [[Fremont, California]], with offices in [[Bakersfield]], California, [[Muscat, Oman]], [[Kuwait City|Kuwait City, Kuwait]] and [[Shenzhen, China]].
In December 2012, GlassPoint announced $26 million in Series B financing. Investors in the round included [[Royal Dutch Shell]], RockPort Capital, Nth Power and Chrysalix Energy Venture Capital.<ref>{{cite web|title=GlassPoint Solar Raises $26M|url=http://www.pehub.com/176909/glasspoint-solar-raises-26m/|publisher=PE Hub|accessdate=15 August 2013}}</ref>
In September 2014, GlassPoint announced $53 million in Series C financing. Investors in the round included [[Royal Dutch Shell]], [[State General Reserve Fund]] of Oman, RockPort Capital, Nth Power and Chrysalix Energy Venture Capital.<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2014-09-08/glasspoint-solar-gets-53-million-financing-led-by-shell-oman | work=Bloomberg | first=Justin | last=Doom | title=Glasspoint Gets $53 Mln Financing Led by Shell, Oman | date=8 September 2014}}</ref>
To date, GlassPoint has a total of $86.7 million in funding.<ref>https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/glasspoint-solar</ref>
==Projects== ===Berry Petroleum===
[[File:GlassPoint EOR Kern County CA.jpg|thumb|right|The world's first solar EOR project, operated by Berry Petroleum Company in Kern Country, CA, USA.]] In 2011, GlassPoint deployed the world’s first commercial [[solar EOR]] project at an oil field operated by [[Berry Petroleum Company|Berry Petroleum]] in [[Kern County, California|Kern County, Calif., USA]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Cox|first=John|title=Solar oil project debuts in Kern|url=http://www.bakersfieldcalifornian.com/business/x130284466/Solar-oil-project-debuts-in-Kern|publisher=The Bakersfield Californian|accessdate=15 August 2013}}</ref> Built in less than six weeks, the system uses the sun’s [[Radiant energy|radiant heat]] to produce approximately 1 million [[British thermal unit|British Thermal Units]] (Btus) per hour of solar heat. GlassPoint partnered with local firms TJ Cross Engineers and PCL Industrial Services to construct the system, which spans 7,000 square feet of land on the 100-year-old oilfield. The enclosed trough system preheats water to 190 °F used as feedwater for Berry Petroleum’s gas-fired steam generators.
===Petroleum Development Oman===
[[File:GlassPoint Solar PDO EOR Project.jpg|thumb|right|A solar enhanced oil recovery project commissioned by Petroleum Development Oman]]
In May 2013, GlassPoint commissioned the Middle East's first solar EOR project, a 7MWth system developed in partnership with [[Petroleum Development Oman]] (PDO), the largest oil company in the [[Sultanate of Oman]]. The system produces an average of 50 tons of emissions-free steam daily.<ref>{{cite news|last=Mahdi|first=Wael|title=GlassPoint Solar Sees Interest from Middle East Oil Firms|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2013-05-21/glasspoint-solar-sees-interest-from-middle-east-oil-firms.html|publisher=Bloomberg|accessdate=15 August 2013|date=21 May 2013}}</ref> operated successfully for more than 4 years, generating an average of 50 tons of emissions-free steam per day that fed directly into existing thermal EOR operations at PDO’s Amal West oilfield.<ref>{{cite news|title=Performance of an Enclosed Trough EOR system in South Oman|url=http://www.glasspoint.com/media/2013/11/GlassPoint-Performance-of-Enclosed-Trough-FINAL.pdf|publisher=SolarPACES|accessdate=27 June 2014|date=September 2013}}</ref>
The system was completed on time, on budget, and with no Lost Time Injuries demonstrating GlassPoint and PDO’s shared commitment to [[Occupational safety and health|health, safety, security and the environment]] (HSSE). During the first 12 months of operations, actual performance of the GlassPoint system matched output models within a few percent and steam production continues to exceed contracted performance targets. The system recorded 98.6% uptime and maintained regular operations during severe dust and [[Dust storm|sand storms]]. The automated roof-washing unit proved particularly effective in all weather events, restoring system performance overnight.<ref>{{cite news|title=Construction, Operations and Performance of the First Enclosed Trough Solar Steam Generation Pilot for EOR Applications|url=https://www.dropbox.com/s/y8rdvhaiklt08yn/SPE%20169745%20Daniel%20Palmer%20OGWA.pdf|publisher=Society of Petroleum Engineering|accessdate=27 June 2014|date=March 2013}}</ref> The project served as a performance and operational baseline for larger steam generators in Oman and provided PDO with valuable information for planning potential large-scale projects in the future.
In July 2015, Petroleum Development Oman and GlassPoint Solar announced that they signed an agreement to build a 1 GWth solar field. The total solar field will be 1.8KM and the total project will be 3KM. The project, named [[Miraah]], will be the world's largest solar field measured by peak thermal capacity.<ref>{{cite news|title= Ironic Or Economic? Oil Giant To Build World's Largest Solar Project |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/christopherhelman/2015/07/08/oil-giant-to-build-worlds-largest-solar-project/|publisher=Forbs|accessdate=8 July 2015|date=8 July 2015|first=Christopher|last=Helman}}</ref>
In August 2017, GlassPoint and its contractors crossed the threshold of 1.5 million man-hours worked without lost time injury (LTI) at Miraah.
In November 2017, GlassPoint and Petroleum Development Oman (PDO) completed construction on the first block of the Miraah solar plant safely on schedule and in line with budget, and successfully delivered steam to the Amal West oilfield.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20171101005644/en/Petroleum-Development-Oman-GlassPoint-Announce-Commencement-Steam|title=Petroleum Development Oman and GlassPoint Announce Commencement of Steam Delivery From Miraah Solar Plan|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
As of November 2018, the first 100 MWt of Miraah are operating and meeting all performance targets.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://timesofoman.com/article/140597|title=GlassPoint, PDO launch new tech centre|work=Times of Oman|access-date=2018-11-13|language=en-GB}}</ref>
=== Belridge Solar === In November 2017, [[Aera Energy]] and GlassPoint Solar announced a joint project to create California’s largest solar energy field.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://mailchi.mp/glasspoint/belridge-solar-announcement|title=Belridge Solar Announcement|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> Located at the [[South Belridge Oil Field]], the project, called Belridge Solar, will be the first in the world to incorporate solar steam generation with [[Solar power|solar electricity generation]].
The Belridge Oil Field resides near [[Bakersfield, California]]. Once completed, the facility is projected to produce 12 million barrels of steam annually through a 850MW thermal solar steam generator. It is planned to reduce the natural gas used at the Belridge Oil Field for the production and extraction of heavy oil in its [[Enhanced oil recovery|enhanced oil recovery process]] (EOR).
Additionally, a separate 26.5 MW electricity generating facility using photovoltaic panels is planned to power oilfield operations. [[File:Belridgesolar render2.jpg|thumb|A rendering of the Belridge facility, which, when done, will be the largest in California.]] This new facility is predicted to reduce [[Greenhouse gas|carbon emissions]] by more than 376,000 metric tons annually.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/energy-environment/wp/2017/11/29/one-of-the-countrys-biggest-oilfields-turns-to-an-unexpected-power-source-solar/|title=Unexpected Power Source|last=|first=|date=|website=Washington Post|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> This will offset more than one-third of all the cars driven in Bakersfield. It is also expected to create hundreds of jobs throughout [[California]].
This project highlights a growing trend of oil and gas companies partnering with the [[Solar power in the United States|solar energy industry]].
=== Occidental Petroleum of Oman === In November 2018, GlassPoint and [[Occidental Petroleum]] of Oman signed an agreement to cooperate on a solar thermal project to facilitate oil production on an oilfield in the [[Oman|Sultanate of Oman]].
The agreement outlines plans to generate up to 100,000 barrels of solar steam per day for heavy oil production at Mukhaizna oilfield. The proposed solar thermal plant would exceed two gigawatts and could save more than 800,000 tons of carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions each year.
Occidental of Oman would purchase the steam under a long-term off-take agreement, providing a cost-effective, zero-emissions alternative to steam generated using natural gas.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://tradearabia.com/news/OGN_347579.html|title=GlassPoint, Occidental set to develop 2GW Oman solar plant|website=tradearabia.com|access-date=2018-11-13}}</ref>
==In-Country Value== [[File:GlassPoint Trough.jpg|thumb|Glasspoint introduced the concept of an enclosed trough to EOR]] GlassPoint claims its technology can help oil operators free [[natural gas]] currently burned for oil production. This gas can be redirected to higher value applications, such as desalination, industrial development or export as [[Liquified natural gas|LNG]], thus increasing economic well-being. New supply chains associated with solar industries can generate significant societal value as well.
=== GlassPoint Innovation Spur === In January 2018, GlassPoint signed a collaboration agreement with a host of partners to establish its corporate social responsibility initiative, the ‘GlassPoint Innovation Spur’.
The program is set to contribute and sustainably drive innovation within Oman’s renewable energy and water management sectors. The list of partners includes The Research Council (TRC), Innovation Park Muscat (IPM), Public Authority for SME Development (Riyada) and Sharakah.
An intensive full-cycle incubation program, the GlassPoint Innovation Spur will provide aspiring Omani entrepreneurs with an integrated ecosystem of scientific, technical and business support. The two-year program will equip participants with valuable skills through coaching and mentorship, as they transform their innovations into implementable businesses. Robust screening, selection, and testing criteria is in place to ensure originality and economic feasibility. Selected entrepreneurs will receive practical support to further develop their inventions and establish businesses before being linked to investors.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.glasspoint.com/glasspoint-innovation-spur-launched-to-drive-renewable-energy-development-in-oman/|title=You are being redirected...|website=www.glasspoint.com|access-date=2018-11-14}}</ref>
=== SolaRISE Technology Center === In September 2018, GlassPoint Solar in partnership with [[Petroleum Development Oman]] (PDO) announced a new technology center.
The joint initiative is called SolaRISE for Solar Research, Innovation, and Sustainability in Energy. It was formed to develop and test solar technologies in oil fields.
Researchers will focus on cutting costs and automating operations. The center also will pilot and evaluate solar energy uses for other industrial processes in Oman and worldwide.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.glasspoint.com/glasspoint-and-petroleum-development-oman-launch-solarise-technology-center/|title=You are being redirected...|website=www.glasspoint.com|access-date=2018-11-14}}</ref>
==Awards== * ''[[Platts]] Global Energy Awards 2011''. Commercial Technology of the Year Award<ref>{{cite web|title=2011 Platts Global Energy Awards|url=http://geaweb.platts.com/Winners/Winners2011|accessdate=August 15, 2013}}</ref> * ''Oil & Gas Middle East Awards 2013''. Enhanced Oil Recovery Award<ref>{{cite|title=Winners of the OGME Awards 2013|url=http://www.arabianoilandgas.com/article-11486-winners-of-ogme-2013-awards-are/#.UmWXx5RgZyg|publisher=Arabian Oil and Gas|accessdate=June 27, 2014}}</ref> * ''[[MEED]] Quality Awards 2014''. Oman Sustainable Project of the Year<ref>{{cite|title=Oman Sustainable Project of the Year|url=http://www.meed.com/supplements/2014/the-meed-quality-awards-for-projects-2014-national-winners-/oman-sustainable-project-of-the-year/3190761.article|publisher=Middle East Economic Digest|accessdate=June 27, 2014}}</ref> * ''MENASOL'' CSP Technology Innovation for MENA 2015<ref>{{cite|title=Oman Sustainable Project of the Year|url=http://www.zawya.com/story/GlassPoint_wins_MENASOL_Award_for_CSP_Technology_Innovation-ZAWYA20150520091723/|publisher=Zawya|accessdate=July 9, 2015}}</ref> * Oil & Gas Middle East 2016. Best EOR Project of the Year <ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.arabianoilandgas.com/oil-gas-awards/|title=Oil & Gas Awards|website=www.arabianoilandgas.com|language=en-US|access-date=2017-08-21}}</ref> * SolarPACES 2016. Technology Innovation Award <ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.solarpaces.org/awards|title=Awards|website=www.solarpaces.org|language=en-gb|access-date=2017-08-21}}</ref> * World Economic Forum 2016. Technology Pioneer <ref>{{Cite web|url=http://us3.campaign-archive2.com/?u=f818d8875e4e163d88dccbad1&id=c06764c2e6|title=World Economic Forum names GlassPoint a Technology Pioneer|website=us3.campaign-archive2.com|access-date=2017-08-21}}</ref> * Shell Upstream International 2016. Impact Award for Safety & Environment <ref>{{Cite web|url=http://us3.campaign-archive1.com/?u=f818d8875e4e163d88dccbad1&id=5a0f7d0b1d|title=Shell awards GlassPoint and PDO|website=us3.campaign-archive1.com|access-date=2017-08-21}}</ref> * ADIPEC 2015. Best Oil & Gas Innovation or Technology <ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.adipec.com/media-pr/adipec-2015-awards-celebrate-excellence-best-practice-and-innovation-in-energy/|title=Best Oil & Gas Innovation or Technology 2015 (ADIPEC)|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> * MENASOL 2017. CSP Technology Innovation <ref>{{Cite web|url=http://events.newenergyupdate.com/mena/awards-index.php|title=MENA New Energy 2017|website=MENA New Energy 2017|access-date=2017-08-21}}</ref>
==See also== *[[Enhanced oil recovery]] *[[Solar thermal enhanced oil recovery]] *[[Solar thermal energy]] *[[Petroleum Development Oman]] *[[Miraah]] *[[Parabolic trough|Parabolic Trough]] *[[Concentrated solar power|Concentrated Solar Power]] *[[Low-carbon fuel standard]]
